title: Calling It: Brian Rosenwald
description:
On the Gist, Mike checks in with this Lawfare piece, and the U.S. Elections Project.
In the interview, Mike talks with Brian Rosenwald, a media historian and fellow at the University of Pennsylvania, about how election night might play out. They discuss the idea of a red mirage, how Republican governors can bring order to things, and how far-right talk radio is going to digest the results. Rosenwald is the author of Talk Radio’s America: How an Industry Took Over a Political Party That Took Over the United States.
In the spiel, Trump’s bad surrogates.
Email us at thegist@slate.com
Podcast production by Daniel Schroeder and Margaret Kelley.
